DataElement.preferredDefinition: The type of high doses of chemotherapy or radiation therapy, as well as immunosuppressive therapy, administered to a transplant recipient prior to a bone marrow or hematopoietic stem cell transplant.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A therapeutic procedure that involves the transplantation of hematopoietic stem cells, either with the patient as their own donor or from a donor to a patient. This can be used for treatment of malignant and non-malignant diseases.:Administration of high doses of chemotherapy or radiation therapy, as well as immunosuppressive therapy, to a transplant recipient prior to a bone marrow or hematopoietic stem cell transplant.  Conditioning destroys the patient's abnormal blood cells or cancer, as well as slows the patient's immune response against the donor bone marrow (graft rejection).

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A method of replacing the immature blood-forming cells lost due to high-dose chemotherapy, and possibly radiation therapy, used to destroy leukemia cells.  The stem cells are given to the patient after treatment to help the bone marrow recover and continue producing healthy blood cells.

Concepts.definition: A therapeutic procedure that involves the transplantation of hematopoietic stem cells, either with the patient as their own donor or from a donor to a patient. This can be used for treatment of malignant and non-malignant diseases.

Property.preferredDefinition: Administration of high doses of chemotherapy or radiation therapy, as well as immunosuppressive therapy, to a transplant recipient prior to a bone marrow or hematopoietic stem cell transplant.  Conditioning destroys the patient's abnormal blood cells or cancer, as well as slows the patient's immune response against the donor bone marrow (graft rejection).

Concepts.definition: Administration of high doses of chemotherapy or radiation therapy, as well as immunosuppressive therapy, to a transplant recipient prior to a bone marrow or hematopoietic stem cell transplant.  Conditioning destroys the patient's abnormal blood cells or cancer, as well as slows the patient's immune response against the donor bone marrow (graft rejection).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Administration of high doses of chemotherapy or radiation therapy, as well as immunosuppressive therapy, to a transplant recipient prior to a bone marrow or hematopoietic stem cell transplant.  Conditioning destroys the patient's abnormal blood cells or cancer, as well as slows the patient's immune response against the donor bone marrow (graft rejection)._Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A conditioning regimen with high doses of chemotherapy or radiation to eliminate host hematopoietic stem cells prior to restitution via transplantation.

Concepts.definition: A conditioning regimen with high doses of chemotherapy or radiation to eliminate host hematopoietic stem cells prior to restitution via transplantation.

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Nonmyeloablative Allogeneic Hematopoietic Stem Cell Transplantation
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A modification of the standard method of allogeneic hematopoietic stem cell transplantation developed to allow for the therapy to be extended to a patient population that is unable to tolerate treatment with the conventional procedure due to its toxicity.

Concepts.longName: Nonmyeloablative Allogeneic Hematopoietic Stem Cell Transplantation
Concepts.definition: A modification of the standard method of allogeneic hematopoietic stem cell transplantation developed to allow for the therapy to be extended to a patient population that is unable to tolerate treatment with the conventional procedure due to its toxicity.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A method of preparation for stem cell transplant that uses less than standard doses of chemotherapy and radiation prior to the transfer of stem cells, with the goal of providing protection against graft vs. host disease, while simultaneously minimizing the toxic effects of the conditioning treatment.

Concepts.definition: A method of preparation for stem cell transplant that uses less than standard doses of chemotherapy and radiation prior to the transfer of stem cells, with the goal of providing protection against graft vs. host disease, while simultaneously minimizing the toxic effects of the conditioning treatment.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.
